Retention
Economic Development Tool:
● Employers struggle to recruit workers without affordable housing options
● Healthcare facilities need housing for travel nurses and new graduates
● University benefits from stable, affordable off-campus housing
● Essential services (teachers, first responders) require local housing options
Retention Benefits:
● Reduced turnover costs for employers
● Improved job satisfaction and stability
● Community investment by workers who can afford to stay
● Reduced commuting from surrounding areas
Community Fiscal Impact
Property Tax Revenue:
● New construction adds to tax base
● Workforce housing typically well-maintained
● Higher occupancy rates than student-only housing
● Property values stabilized by quality affordable options
Local Economic Multiplier:
● Construction jobs during development phase
● Ongoing property management employment
● Residents spend locally rather than commuting
● Reduced infrastructure strain from sprawl
Social and Health Benefits
Housing Stability Improves Outcomes:
● Better educational outcomes for children in stable housing

Implementation Roadmap
Phase 1: Market Validation and Site Selection (6 months)
● Conduct detailed market study with pre-leasing interest
● Identify optimal sites near USM and employment centers
